attributes.action: restore the 10% basic rate of income tax.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As of April 5th, 2008, the basic rate of income tax set at 10% has been abolished. Taxation now starts at a rate of 20% for all earned income over £5,435 per annum, increasing the tax burden for all those earning under roughly £18,000 while the burden for those earning above that figure has lessened.

We, the undersigned, consider this to be a grossly unfair and regressive revision of UK taxation policy, and not in keeping with a society that protects its poorest members. We call on the Government to reverse this change and restore the 10% rate of income tax.
